David Hope

Quantitative Migratory Shorebird Biologist

Research Interests

My research interests lay in behavioural ecology and conservation biology. I have a strong statistical background, but fieldwork really is the carrot that drives me forward. I have worked with various study species including western sandpipers, raccoons, deer mice, black bears, blue and great tits, and reindeer.











PhD Research

Currently, population status migrating shorebird species are determined through laborious counts that provide unreliable population trends only after many years of work. I explored the role that behavioural variation to changing conditions can play in shaping the counts of shorebirds on migration. You can learn more about this project at the project webpage
